snippet: What rules, if any, do you think should govern how companies collect and use personal and aggregate data?
abstract: What rules, if any, do you think should govern how companies collect and use personal and aggregate data?
lead_paragraph: Facebook has swelled to an estimated 845 million users, who typically share everything from their last name to their favorite movies -- even phone numbers and e-mails. What users may not realize is that advertisers then use this information to customize what ads appear on a user's page. What sort of impression do you think advertisers and companies might have of you, based on how you use Facebook and search engines like Google?

headline.main: What Story Does Your Personal Data Tell?
